title: 13-year-old girl injured in Columbia shooting
content:
COLUMBIA, SC (WIS) -
The Columbia Police Department is investigating a shooting that left one child in the hospital.
According to a post on CPD's social media account, the shooting happened early Saturday morning on the 2400 block of McKinley Street near Farrow Road.
Officers say a 13-year-old girl was grazed by a bullet in the shooting. She was taken to a local hospital with what appeared to be non-life threatening injuries, according to officers.
CPD continues to investigate the shooting. Anyone with any information on this shooting is urged to contact Crimestoppers in any of the following ways:
PHONE: Call 1-888-CRIME SC (888-274-6372)
TEXT: TIPSC plus your tip info to CRIMES (274637)
ONLINE: www.midlandscrimestoppers.com and email a tip.
Your identity will be kept anonymous, and if your tip leads to an arrest, you could be eligible for a cash reward of up to $1,000.
